nodes.name: demographic
nodes.description: Data for the characterization of the patient by means of segementing the population (e.g., characterization by age, sex, or race).

properties.name: cause_of_death
properties.description: Text term to identify the cause of patient death with respect to cancer.

properties.name: days_to_birth
properties.description: The number of days between the index date and the date of patient birth. If the number of days is greater than 32872 (89 years), then please use 'days_to_birth_gt89'.

properties.name: days_to_birth_gt89
properties.description: Indicate if the number of days between the index date and the date of patient birth is greater than 32872 (89 years).

properties.name: days_to_death
properties.description: The number of days between the index date and the date of patient death.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: race
properties.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: self_identified_gender
properties.description: The sex or gender assignment preferred by the participant.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'demographic' table.

properties.name: demographic.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'demographic' table.

nodes.name: diagnosis
nodes.description: Data from the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis
properties.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth. If the age at diagnosis is greater than 32872 days (89 years), then see 'age_at_diagnosis_gt89'.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis_gt89
properties.description: Indicate if the age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth is greater than 32872 days (89 years).

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_m
properties.description: Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_n
properties.description: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_stage
properties.description: Stage group determined from clinical information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for cancer.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_t
properties.description: Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_m
properties.description: Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_n
properties.description: The codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_t
properties.description: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: best_overall_response
properties.description: The best improvement achieved throughout the entire course of protocol treatment.

properties.name: bmi
properties.description: The body mass divided by the square of the body height expressed in units of kg/m^2.

properties.name: cancer_grade
properties.description: Associated cancer grade (e.g. 0, 1, 2, 3, 4).

properties.name: cancer_grading_system
properties.description: Identification of the staging system used to determine cancer grades.

properties.name: cancer_stage
properties.description: Stage of Cancer identified at diagnosis, Including specific TNM staging vocabulary.

properties.name: cancer_staging_system
properties.description: Identification of the staging system used to measure cancers' status and progression.

properties.name: cancer_type
properties.description: Type of Cancer identified at diagnosis, Including specific histopathology information.

properties.name: classification_of_tumor
properties.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

properties.name: days_to_best_overall_response
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's best overall response.

properties.name: days_to_diagnosis
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's diagnosis.

properties.name: days_to_last_surgery
properties.description: Time from last surgery in days

properties.name: days_to_metastatic_diagnosis
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's metastasis initially identified and diagnose.

properties.name: metastatic_disease_status
properties.description: Indication of whether disease is metastatic at the moment participant is enrolled.

properties.name: metastatic_site
properties.description: Location of metastatic disease

properties.name: method_of_diagnosis
properties.description: The method used to initially the patient's diagnosis.

properties.name: morphology
properties.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

properties.name: overall_survival
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the patient's date of death or the date the patient was last known to be alive.

properties.name: primary_diagnosis
properties.description: Text term for the structural pattern of cancer cells used to define a microscopic diagnosis.

properties.name: prior_malignancy
properties.description: Text term to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis and the spatial location of any previous cancer occurrence.

properties.name: prior_treatment
properties.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

properties.name: progression_free_survival
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the first date the patient is known to be free of disease progression.

properties.name: progression_free_survival_event
properties.description: The event used to define the patient's disease progression.

properties.name: residual_disease
properties.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.

properties.name: tissue_or_organ_of_origin
properties.description: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the tumor or disease.

properties.name: tumor_detectable_at_draw
properties.description: Is the tumor detectable by the standard of care ie blood draw, imaging, exam, at the time of draw?

properties.name: tumor_grade
properties.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.

nodes.name: followup
nodes.description: A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional. A clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures and assessments that may be performed on a subject. A visit has a start and an end, each described with a rule. The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained before and after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

properties.name: adverse_event
properties.description: Text that represents the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events low level term name for an adverse event.

properties.name: bmi

properties.name: cause_of_response

properties.name: days_to_adverse_event

properties.name: days_to_recurrence

nodes.name: biospecimen
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products. In the case of contrived samples, it describes any material obtained from a normal donor. Link this record to the followup node in order to record patient context variables related to blood draws or biospecimen collection.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample.

properties.name: biospecimen_type
properties.description: A top level description of the biospecimen. Is the biospecimen a fluid or solid tissue?

properties.name: biospecimen_volume
properties.description: For fluid biospecimens this is the total volume in milliliters.

properties.name: biospecimen_weight
properties.description: For solid tissue biospecimens this is the total weight in milligrams.

properties.name: blood_draw_method
properties.description: The name or generalized description of the method used to draw a blood biospecimen. Alternatively, if you have provided a blood draw protocol, put the associated file_name here.

properties.name: blood_tube_type
properties.description: The kind of tube used to collect the sample(s) taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes.

properties.name: clinical_site
properties.description: The name or identifier for the clinical site at which the biospecimen was taken from the patient.

properties.name: collaboration_id
properties.description: In cases where the same biospecimen is used by multiple institutions, a deidenfitied id may provided here to tie those together. Work with your collaborators assure the same id is in all projects.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: The number of days between the index date and the date the biospecimen was received at laboratory that will be processing the biospecimen. If this value is anything other than an integer, for example, "Unknown", "Not Reported" or "Not Applicable", etc., record this text value in 'days_to_collection_other'.

properties.name: days_to_collection_other
properties.description: If 'days_to_collection' is anything other than an integer, for example, "Unknown", "Not Reported" or "Not Applicable", etc., record that value here.

properties.name: days_to_procurement
properties.description: The number of days between the index date and the date the biospecimen was taken from the patient, such as a blood draw. If this value is anything other than an integer, for example, "Unknown", "Not Reported" or "Not Applicable", etc., record this text value in 'days_to_procurement_other'.

properties.name: days_to_procurement_other
properties.description: If 'days_to_procurement' is anything other than an integer, for example, "Unknown", "Not Reported" or "Not Applicable", etc., record that value here.

properties.name: disease_type
properties.description: The primary disease of the patient from which the biospecimen was taken.

properties.name: metastatic_bone
properties.description: True/False indicator of whether metastasis had been confirmed in an area of bone of the patient from which the biospecimen was taken.

properties.name: metastatic_lymph_node
properties.description: True/False indicator of whether metastasis had been confirmed in the lymph nodes of the patient from which the biospecimen was taken.

properties.name: metastatic_visceral
properties.description: True/False indicator of whether metastasis had been confirmed in the viscera of the patient from which the biospecimen was taken.

properties.name: method_of_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: The site of the primary tumor for the patient from which the biospecimen was taken.

properties.name: procured_or_purchased
properties.description: Was the biospecimen purchased from a vendor or procured from a study participant.

properties.name: procurement_temperature
properties.description: The temperature, in centigrade, at which the biospecimen was kept after procuring it from the patient. Use 20 for room temperature; 0 for on ice.

properties.name: shipping_temperature
properties.description: The temperature, in centigrade, at which the biospecimen was kept while it was being transported from the procurement site to its processing destination.

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: tumor_code
properties.description: A specification of a cancer through cellular origin and localization.

properties.name: tumor_descriptor
properties.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

properties.name: tumor_morphology
properties.description: The specific description of the tumor morphology. Please use the ICD-0-3 code name (e.g. "Neoplasm, benign", "Carcinoma, Nos", or "Hepatocellular adenoma").

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'biospecimen' table.

properties.name: followup.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'followup' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'biospecimen' table.

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'biospecimen' table.
